column5: Hi All:  I will be coming the from Barrie this time too the Tyler event. Where between Barrie and the Inisfill can you get minnows

Simcoe Bait and tackle 250 Innisfil st 737-4819 , corner of Tiffen and Innisfil st From Hwy 400 Essa road east to innisfil street North On the left just past the rail way tracks just up from the Tiffen st Boat launch  Innsifil bait and tackle ( hwy 11 and Innisfil beach rd) but have never been there  TB
Paulyanna fish huts at the end of the 9th line(on the ice) has minnows also....TC and see ya there.....Chuck....
For those coming up from the south (Toronto etc)...  Innisfil Bait and Tackle... Hwy 89 and Yonge St (Hwy 11) on the south/west corner
Beans is correct I had the wrong corner ..sorry TB

There's also 'Loves to fish Simcoe',between the 4th and the 5th on Ewart rd.(just follow the 4th around the bend),they also donated a few rod and reel combo's for the prize table as well as a nice bag of lures....They are fully stocked with just about everything you 'll need to enjoy your day......TC and see ya there.......Chuck...
Are minnows the only bait one should use? I have never done this before, any advice is welcome. If this is a thread hijack, I apologize.

you planning to fish for perch or whitefish?  TB  Small jigs , drop shots or pickeral rigs ( small hooks) all tipped with small minnows work well for perch. Fish at or very near bottom and be prepared to move around to find fish.
I am going for perch, I suppose...
